// State to language mapping
const stateToLanguage = {
  Karnataka: 'kn',
  'Tamil Nadu': 'ta',
  Kerala: 'ml',
  Telangana: 'te',
  'Andhra Pradesh': 'te'
  // Default to English if state not found
};

// City to state mapping (for auto-detection)
const cityToState = {
  'Bengaluru': 'Karnataka',
  'Bangalore': 'Karnataka',
  'Mysuru': 'Karnataka',
  'Mysore': 'Karnataka',
  'Mangaluru': 'Karnataka',
  'Mangalore': 'Karnataka',
  'Chennai': 'Tamil Nadu',
  'Madurai': 'Tamil Nadu',
  'Coimbatore': 'Tamil Nadu',
  'Thiruvananthapuram': 'Kerala',
  'Kochi': 'Kerala',
  'Kozhikode': 'Kerala',
  'Calicut': 'Kerala',
  'Hyderabad': 'Telangana',
  'Vijayawada': 'Andhra Pradesh',
  'Visakhapatnam': 'Andhra Pradesh',
  'Amaravati': 'Andhra Pradesh'
};

/**
 * Get language code based on city or state
 * @param {string} city - City name
 * @param {string} state - State name (optional)
 * @returns {string} Language code (en, sa, kn, ta, te, ml)
 */
export const getLanguageFromLocation = (city, state = null) => {
  if (state && stateToLanguage[state]) {
    return stateToLanguage[state];
  }
  if (city && cityToState[city]) {
    const detectedState = cityToState[city];
    return stateToLanguage[detectedState] || 'en';
  }
  return 'en'; // Default to English
};

/**
 * Get translation for a key
 * @param {string} key - Translation key
 * @param {string} lang - Language code (en, sa, kn, ta, te, ml)
 * @returns {string} Translated text
 */
export const t = (key, lang = 'en') => {
  var _translations$lang;
  return ((_translations$lang = translations[lang]) === null || _translations$lang === void 0 ? void 0 : _translations$lang[key]) || translations.en[key] || key;
};

/**
 * Get translations for multiple languages
 * @param {string} key - Translation key
 * @param {Array<string>} langs - Array of language codes
 * @returns {Object} Object with translations for each language
 */
export const getMultiLang = (key, langs = ['en', 'sa']) => {
  const result = {};
  langs.forEach(lang => {
    result[lang] = t(key, lang);
  });
  return result;
};

/**
 * Format text with both English and regional language
 * @param {string} key - Translation key
 * @param {string} regionalLang - Regional language code
 * @param {string} separator - Separator between languages (default: ' / ')
 * @returns {string} Formatted text
 */
export const formatDualLang = (key, regionalLang = 'en', separator = ' / ') => {
  const english = t(key, 'en');
  const regional = t(key, regionalLang);
  const sanskrit = t(key, 'sa');
  if (regionalLang === 'en') {
    return `${english} (${sanskrit})`;
  }
  return `${english} (${sanskrit}) / ${regional}`;
};
export default translations;

sourcesContent:
/**
 * Panchang Translations
 * Multi-language support for Vedic Panchang display
 * Supports: English, Sanskrit, Kannada, Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam
 */

const translations = {
  en: {
    // Common terms
    todayPanchang: "Today's Panchang",
    tithi: "Tithi",
    nakshatra: "Nakshatra",
    yoga: "Yoga",
    karana: "Karana",
    vara: "Day",
    sunrise: "Sunrise",
    sunset: "Sunset",
    moonrise: "Moonrise",
    moonset: "Moonset",
    rahuKaal: "Rahu Kaal",
    yamaganda: "Yamaganda",
    gulika: "Gulika",
    abhijitMuhurat: "Abhijit Muhurat",
    brahmaMuhurat: "Brahma Muhurat",
    shubhaKala: "Shubha Kala",
    avoid: "AVOID",
    bestFor: "BEST FOR",
    until: "Until",
    then: "Then",
    duration: "Duration",
    minutes: "minutes",
    hinduCalendar: "Hindu Calendar",
    vikramSamvat: "Vikram Samvat",
    shakaSamvat: "Shaka Samvat",
    samvatsara: "Samvatsara",
    purnimanta: "Purnimanta",
    amanta: "Amanta",
    paksha: "Paksha",
    ritu: "Ritu",
    ayana: "Ayana",
    rulingPlanet: "Ruling Planet",
    specialObservances: "Special Observances",
    inauspiciousTimes: "Inauspicious Times - Avoid These",
    auspiciousTimes: "Auspicious Times",
    sunMoonTimings: "Sun & Moon Timings",
    fiveLimbs: "The Five Limbs (Panch-Anga)",
    firstHalf: "First Half",
    secondHalf: "Second Half",
    pada: "Pada",
    mostAuspicious: "MOST AUSPICIOUS",
    auspicious: "AUSPICIOUS",
    inauspicious: "INAUSPICIOUS",
    neutral: "NEUTRAL",
    ekadashi: "EKADASHI",
    purnima: "PURNIMA",
    amavasya: "AMAVASYA",
    bhadra: "BHADRA (Inauspicious)",
    morning: "Morning",
    evening: "Evening",
  },
  sa: {
    // Sanskrit

// State to language mapping
const stateToLanguage = {
  Karnataka: 'kn',
  'Tamil Nadu': 'ta',
  Kerala: 'ml',
  Telangana: 'te',
  'Andhra Pradesh': 'te',
  // Default to English if state not found
};

// City to state mapping (for auto-detection)
const cityToState = {
  'Bengaluru': 'Karnataka',
  'Bangalore': 'Karnataka',
  'Mysuru': 'Karnataka',
  'Mysore': 'Karnataka',
  'Mangaluru': 'Karnataka',
  'Mangalore': 'Karnataka',
  'Chennai': 'Tamil Nadu',
  'Madurai': 'Tamil Nadu',
  'Coimbatore': 'Tamil Nadu',
  'Thiruvananthapuram': 'Kerala',
  'Kochi': 'Kerala',
  'Kozhikode': 'Kerala',
  'Calicut': 'Kerala',
  'Hyderabad': 'Telangana',
  'Vijayawada': 'Andhra Pradesh',
  'Visakhapatnam': 'Andhra Pradesh',
  'Amaravati': 'Andhra Pradesh',
};

/**
 * Get language code based on city or state
 * @param {string} city - City name
 * @param {string} state - State name (optional)
 * @returns {string} Language code (en, sa, kn, ta, te, ml)
 */
export const getLanguageFromLocation = (city, state = null) => {
  if (state && stateToLanguage[state]) {
    return stateToLanguage[state];
  }
  if (city && cityToState[city]) {
    const detectedState = cityToState[city];
    return stateToLanguage[detectedState] || 'en';
  }
  return 'en'; // Default to English
};

/**
 * Get translation for a key
 * @param {string} key - Translation key
 * @param {string} lang - Language code (en, sa, kn, ta, te, ml)
 * @returns {string} Translated text
 */
export const t = (key, lang = 'en') => {
  return translations[lang]?.[key] || translations.en[key] || key;
};

/**
 * Get translations for multiple languages
 * @param {string} key - Translation key
 * @param {Array<string>} langs - Array of language codes
 * @returns {Object} Object with translations for each language
 */
export const getMultiLang = (key, langs = ['en', 'sa']) => {
  const result = {};
  langs.forEach(lang => {
    result[lang] = t(key, lang);
  });
  return result;
};

/**
 * Format text with both English and regional language
 * @param {string} key - Translation key
 * @param {string} regionalLang - Regional language code
 * @param {string} separator - Separator between languages (default: ' / ')
 * @returns {string} Formatted text
 */
export const formatDualLang = (key, regionalLang = 'en', separator = ' / ') => {
  const english = t(key, 'en');
  const regional = t(key, regionalLang);
  const sanskrit = t(key, 'sa');
  
  if (regionalLang === 'en') {
    return `${english} (${sanskrit})`;
  }
  return `${english} (${sanskrit}) / ${regional}`;
};

export default translations;
